items.sentence: I thought Tom and Mary were still studying French.
I thought Tom might sing a couple of songs for us.
I thought Tom was planning on staying for a month.
I thought Tom would appreciate the gift from Mary.
Tom thinks the dress I bought for Mary is too big.
Tom was Mary\'s boyfriend all through high school.
Is there any chance you can get that done by 2:30?
I\'m worried about what\'s going to happen to Tom.
Tom finds Mary\'s mother to be quite intimidating.
Tom gave Mary the note I\'d given him to give her.
I\'m pretty sure Tom doesn\'t like Mary very much.
Don\'t worry. Everything\'s going to be all right.
I\'m planning on staying at Tom\'s tomorrow night.
Tom couldn\'t believe nobody laughed at his jokes.
I\'m sure Tom hasn\'t forgotten about the meeting.
Are you sure it was Tom and not Mary who did that?
It isn\'t surprising that Tom is proud of his son.
Maybe you ought to let Tom do what he wants to do.
Tom didn\'t come home last night. I hope he\'s OK.
Tom promised not to tell Mary about what happened.
